lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Rawl said synthetic fuel would become economic at lower prices because companies are investigating "a new generation of ideas that promise substantially lower costs" and projects begun in the late 1970s, which have since been suspended.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But, he added, Exxon projects that "despite today's ample supplies, the world will also be facing up to inherent limitations on the availability of oil and gas, which currently supplies more than half of the world's energy needs."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The Exxon chairman also criticized "the occasional attempt of consuming nations to try to control domestic oil prices, calling such protectionist measures disruptive to the world oil market.
